metadata.title: CVE-2016-1923 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low
metadata.description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the opj_j2k_update_image_data function inOpenJpeg 2016.1.18 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(out-of-bounds read and application crash) via a crafted JPEG 2000 image.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1923` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4
libopenjp2-tools - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4
libopenjp3d7 - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4
libopenjpip-server - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4
libopenjpip7 - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.3.1-1ubuntu4').
